description:
The second season of Megalo Box.

In the end, “Gearless” Joe was the one that reigned as the champion of Megalonia, a first ever megalobox tournament. Fans everywhere were mesmerized by the meteoric rise of Joe who sprung out from the deepest underground ring to the top in mere three months and without the use of gear. Seven years later, “Gearless” Joe was once again fighting in underground matches. Adorned with scars and once again donning his gear, but now known only as Nomad.

(Source: TMS Entertainment)
synonyms: เมกาโล่บ็อกซ์ เจ้าสังเวียนพันธุ์แกร่ง ภาค 2

tags.name: Boxing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of boxing.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

node.description: Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

[Website](http://www.chibapro.co.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/chibatetsu/)

A Japanese manga artist famous for his sports stories.

He was born in Chuo, Tokyo, Japan, but lived most of his early childhood in Shenyang, Liaoning when northeast China was colonized by Japan during the Second Sino-Japanese War. His father was working in a paper factory when they lived in China. Two of his younger brothers are manga artists: Akio Chiba and Shigeyuki Chiba (pen name Taro Nami), who is almost completely unknown outside Japan, despite writing many popular sports manga in Japan. Chiba's works include _Ashita no Joe_, his best known work, and _Notari Matsutarou_. Many of his early titles are still in print due to continued popularity.

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

Asaki Takamori, better known by this pen names Ikki Kajiwara and Asao Takamori, was a Japanese author, manga writer, and film producer. He is known for series about sports and martial arts. He considered [Tiger Mask](https://anilist.co/manga/60575/) and [Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/manga/45305/) to be his life's work.

Formerly married to [Bingbing Pai](https://anilist.co/staff/256250) from 1979 to 1981.

Manabu Yamaguchi, better known by his stage name Mabanua, is a Japanese composer, producer, musician, and singer out of many things. He is currently associated with Origami PRODUCTIONS. Also the drummer for the band Ovall.
